modules.description: This module implements Xen backend console management with operations to check existence, create, run, destroy, and close console connections. It works with Xen client interfaces, domain identifiers, and console statistics, handling low-level lifecycle management of virtual console devices. Concrete use cases include managing console access for virtual machines in a Xen hypervisor environment, coordinating domain shutdowns, and collecting connection metrics.

Implements a Xen backend console interface for MirageOS, handling byte stream transmission and reception over Xen console rings. Tracks cumulative read and write statistics via the `stats` type, which includes `total_read` and `total_write` byte counts. Designed for use in unikernel environments requiring direct Xen console communication with precise I/O monitoring.

Implements a Xen backend console interface for MirageOS, managing bidirectional byte stream transmission and reception through Xen console rings. Tracks cumulative read and write byte counts with the `stats` type, which includes `total_read` and `total_write`. Designed for unikernels needing direct Xen console communication with precise I/O monitoring.
